alert.note: Alert for Greater Oconee; Oconee Mountains (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 01 at 7:45PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of eastern Rabun and Oconee Counties through 830 PM EDT... At 744 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles west of Walhalla, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Seneca, Walhalla, Salem, Lake Jocassee, Devils Fork State Park, Tallulah Gorge State Park, Oconee State Park, Lake Keowee, Westminster and Mountain Rest. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
